questions.question_text: A real estate organization processes photos of properties uploaded by their agents to an internal application. They must manually check and remove photos that contain personally identifiable information like passports and credit cards. They want a solution that their developer can use to integrate with their app as quickly as possible. Which solution should they use?

comments.content: D. BigQuery ML: BigQuery ML allows users to build machine learning models directly within BigQuery, typically for structured data like tabular data. It is not well-suited for image processing, which is the need here (analyzing photos for PII). This option is more appropriate for data analytics or predictions based on structured data rather than image-based PII detection.

Why the other options are incorrect:
B. AutoML: While AutoML allows developers to build custom models with machine learning, it requires more effort than pre-trained APIs. It involves training a model on custom data, which might be beneficial if the organization needs a model tailored to their specific use case. However, it’s not as quick or straightforward as using a pre-trained API, which is what the organization needs for fast integration.

C. Custom training: Custom training refers to the process of creating entirely custom machine learning models from scratch. This option requires a deep understanding of machine learning and more time to prepare and train the model. Given the organization's need for a fast solution, this approach would be overkill and not as efficient as using pre-trained APIs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Pre-trained APIs.

Pre-trained APIs are ready-to-use models provided by Google Cloud, such as the Cloud Vision API, which can detect a wide range of sensitive information, including personally identifiable information (PII) like passports, credit cards, and other sensitive data in images. These APIs are quick to integrate into applications, as they don't require additional training, allowing the developer to focus on the application rather than building or fine-tuning models.

Selected Answer: A
Cloud Vision API

Selected Answer: A
Answer A

comments.content: D. An AI model for labeling images: Labeling images typically involves supervised learning, where a model is trained to classify or label images based on predefined categories. This is a form of discriminative AI, not generative AI. Generative AI, in contrast, creates new data (e.g., images, text) rather than categorizing existing data.

Why the other options are incorrect:
A. A machine learning model for language translation: While language translation models, such as Google Translate, use machine learning, they are not considered generative AI. Generative AI is focused on creating new content, not just transforming one type of content into another. Language translation is an example of a transformational task, not a generative one.

C. An umbrella term that includes all types of machine learning algorithms: This is incorrect because generative AI is not an umbrella term for all machine learning algorithms. It is a specific subset of AI focused on content creation, while machine learning as a whole encompasses a broad range of techniques like classification, regression, clustering, etc.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. A specific field of AI that can be used to create content.

Generative AI refers to a specific type of AI that is capable of generating new content, such as text, images, music, and even video. This type of AI uses models like GPT (for text) or GANs (for images) to produce content based on patterns it has learned from large datasets. These models do not merely classify or analyze data; instead, they generate entirely new, original content.

choices.D: An AI model for labeling images
choices.A: A machine learning model for language translation
choices.B: A specific field of AI that can be used to create content
choices.C: An umbrella term that includes all types of machine learning algorithms

Selected Answer: B
Mobile app -> Firebase

D: App Engine

Firebase is a mobile and web application development platform, and while it provides features for backend services, authentication, and real-time database, it may not be a fully featured cloud-based compute platform for all types of applications. App Engine, on the other hand, is a fully managed serverless platform that allows you to build and deploy applications without managing the underlying infrastructure. If your organization is developing a mobile app and wants a cloud-based compute platform, App Engine would be a more suitable choice. Firebase could still be used for specific features within the app, but it may not cover all the compute needs for the application.

Selected Answer: D
App Engine is a platform-as-a-service (PaaS) offering that allows developers to build and deploy applications easily, without worrying about infrastructure management. It provides automatic scaling, load balancing, and supports multiple programming languages, making it suitable for mobile app development.

Selected Answer: D
App Engine is a platform-as-a-service (PaaS) offering that allows developers to build and deploy applications easily, without worrying about infrastructure management. It provides automatic scaling, load balancing, and supports multiple programming languages, making it suitable for mobile app development.

The correct answer is D. App Engine.

Google Cloud's App Engine is a fully managed platform for building and deploying web and mobile applications. It supports multiple programming languages, and provides a flexible and scalable platform for running cloud-based compute workloads. With App Engine, your organization can easily deploy and manage web and mobile applications without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.

Option B, Firebase, is a mobile and web application development platform that provides a range of features and services for building, testing, and deploying mobile and web applications. While Firebase is a great platform for mobile application development, it may not provide all the compute features needed for more complex applications.

firebase.google.com/docs/hosting/serverless-overview

Serve dynamic content and host microservices using Firebase Hosting 
Firebase Hosting integrates with serverless computing options, including Cloud Functions for Firebase and Cloud Run. Using Firebase Hosting with these options, you can host microservices by directing HTTPS requests to trigger your functions and containerized apps to run in a managed, secure environment.

Cloud Functions for Firebase: You write and deploy a function, which is backend code that responds to a specific trigger. Then, using Firebase Hosting, you can direct HTTPS requests to trigger your function to run.

Cloud Run: You write and deploy an application packaged in a container image. Then, using Firebase Hosting, you can direct HTTPS requests to trigger your containerized app to run.

questions.question_text:
Your organization is developing a mobile app and wants to select a fully featured cloud-based compute platform for it.
Which Google Cloud product or feature should your organization use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Processing data records continuously.

Streaming analytics refers to the real-time or continuous processing of data as it is ingested. The defining characteristic of streaming analytics is its ability to process data in real time, allowing organizations to gain insights or take actions immediately as data flows in from various sources. This is essential for applications that require quick responses, such as monitoring systems, fraud detection, and real-time recommendation engines.

comments.content: D. Accessing data with high latency: Streaming analytics is focused on low-latency data processing, meaning it is designed to provide near-instantaneous analysis. High latency in data access is contrary to the purpose of streaming analytics, which aims to minimize delay and enable real-time decision-making.

Why the other options are incorrect:
B. Processing data records in batches: Batch processing involves processing data in large, discrete chunks or batches over a specific time period. This is the opposite of streaming analytics, which focuses on real-time processing. Batch processing is typically used for workloads where real-time processing isn't necessary and is more efficient for large-scale data processing at scheduled intervals.

C. Processing a one-off data backfill: A one-off data backfill refers to a situation where historical data is processed to fill in missing information or to reprocess data after an issue has been detected. This is not a characteristic of streaming analytics, which is concerned with continuously processing data as it comes in, rather than handling historical or backlog data.

questions.question_text: What is a defining function of streaming analytics?

choices.B: The policy will be inherited by the projects and their resources within the folder.
choices.C: The policy will be applied to all folders within the organization.
choices.A: The policy will be inherited by the projects in the folder but will not affect their resources.
choices.D: The policy applies to the folder only, and will not be inherited by any projects.

questions.question_text: An organization is deciding on the layout of their resource hierarchy in Google Cloud. They have several projects within a folder. What will happen when user access policies are applied to the folder?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The policy will be inherited by the projects and their resources within the folder.

When user access policies (IAM policies) are applied at the folder level in Google Cloud, these policies are inherited by all projects within that folder and also apply to the resources within those projects. This inheritance ensures that the access controls set at the folder level are enforced consistently across all the projects and their resources, providing centralized management of permissions.

comments.content:
Why the other options are incorrect:
A. The policy will be inherited by the projects in the folder but will not affect their resources: This is incorrect because the IAM policy applied at the folder level does affect both the projects and the resources within those projects. Resources like virtual machines, storage buckets, etc., will inherit the folder's IAM policy as well.

C. The policy will be applied to all folders within the organization: This is incorrect because IAM policies applied at one folder level only affect that folder and its contained projects/resources. It does not automatically propagate to other folders within the organization unless explicitly set for those folders as well.

D. The policy applies to the folder only, and will not be inherited by any projects: This is incorrect because IAM policies set at the folder level do get inherited by the projects within that folder, making it easier to manage access controls at a higher level in the hierarchy.
